item.title: Quick Explainer: Activation Checkpointing
item.description: What is activation checkpointing? Activation checkpointing is a technique used to save GPU memory while training large deep learning models. During the training of a deep learning model, we store the activations in memory to calculate the gradients during the backward pass. Activation checkpointing literally skips the saving part, thus saving a lot of memory.
